tasks.title: YuiQuery White Paper Development Instructions
tasks.description:
# YuiQuery White Paper Development Instructions

## Project Overview
YuiQuery by Yuimedi is a healthcare data analytics platform. This document provides comprehensive instructions for developing professional white papers that effectively communicate YuiQuery's capabilities, use cases, and value propositions to healthcare organizations, data professionals, and decision-makers.

## Core Mission
Create authoritative, data-driven white papers that establish thought leadership in healthcare analytics...

tasks.title: Document YuiQuery Healthcare Data Integration Architecture with RAG and Schema Mapping References
tasks.description:
# Document YuiQuery Healthcare Data Integration Architecture with RAG and Schema Mapping References

## Objective
Incorporate the Anthropic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) guide as a referenced technical methodology in the YuiQuery whitepaper to provide evidence-based context for knowledge retrieval approaches.

## Source Document
- **URL**: https://github.com/anthropics/anthropic-cookbook/blob/main/skills/retrieval_augmented_generation/guide.ipynb
- **Type**: Technical implementation guide...

tasks.title: Implement Query Classification and Data Catalog Generation Using Anthropic Classification Methodology
tasks.description:
# Implement Query Classification and Data Catalog Generation Using Anthropic Classification Methodology

## Objective
Document YuiQuery's classification capabilities for query routing and data catalog automation, referencing Anthropic's classification guide as technical methodology baseline.

## Source Document
- **URL**: https://github.com/anthropics/anthropic-cookbook/blob/main/skills/classification/guide.ipynb
- **Type**: Technical implementation guide (Jupyter notebook)
- **Publisher**: Anth...

tasks.title: Reference Issues in YuiQuery Research Paper - Validated Observations
tasks.description:
# Reference Issues in YuiQuery Research Paper - Validated Observations

## Document Information
- **Title**: YuiQuery: Natural Language to SQL in Healthcare
- **Date**: August 2025
- **Claimed Sources**: 111 academic and industry sources

## Validated Issues

### 1. Reference Count Discrepancy
**Observation**: Paper claims "111 academic and industry sources" in multiple locations
**Actual Count**: 
- Academic sources listed: A1-A23 (23 references)
- Industry sources listed: I1-I30 (30 references...

tasks.title: Merge YuiQuery AI Teammate Benchmarking Report into Main Paper
tasks.description:
# Merge YuiQuery AI Teammate Benchmarking Report into Main Paper

## Issue Type
Documentation Update / Content Merge

## Description
Integrate the YuiQuery AI Teammate Benchmarking Report findings into the main paper at `paper.md`. This benchmarking study provides critical empirical evidence supporting the effectiveness of AI-powered data extraction tools in healthcare research environments.

## Content to Merge

### 1. Executive Summary Metrics
- **40% time savings** for data teams in SQL query...

tasks.title: The JSON contains shell variable expansion syntax `${references.salary_data}` which will not work in JSON context. This should either be a literal URL or use a different templating approach.
tasks.description:
The JSON contains shell variable expansion syntax `${references.salary_data}` which will not work in JSON context. This should either be a literal URL or use a different templating approach.
```suggestion
          "echo '# Backup Developer Role

## Requirements
- Healthcare data experience
- Python/SQL proficiency
- 10 hours/week availability

## Budget: $15,000-20,000

Reference: https://www.glassdoor.com/Salaries/healthcare-data-analyst-salary-SRCH_KO0,23.htm' > ./project-managemen...

tasks.title: The increase_factor of 12.4 is mathematically incorrect. $33,495 ÷ $2,700 = 12.4, but the grand_total is $33,495 while the subtotal before contingency is $30,450. The factor should be calculated against the appropriate base amount.
tasks.description:
The increase_factor of 12.4 is mathematically incorrect. $33,495 ÷ $2,700 = 12.4, but the grand_total is $33,495 while the subtotal before contingency is $30,450. The factor should be calculated against the appropriate base amount.
```suggestion
    "increase_factor": 11.28,
```

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pull/39#discussion_r2317819690_

tasks.title: This creates duplicate if statements checking different repository names. The second condition will never be reached because both conditions are checking the same variable in sequence without proper logic flow.
tasks.description:
This creates duplicate if statements checking different repository names. The second condition will never be reached because both conditions are checking the same variable in sequence without proper logic flow.
```suggestion
# List of allowed repository names
ALLOWED_REPOS=("yuimedi-paper-20250901")

REPO_MATCHED=false
for allowed in "${ALLOWED_REPOS[@]}"; do
    if [[ "$REPO_NAME" == "$allowed" ]]; then
        REPO_MATCHED=true
        break
    fi
done

if [[ "$REPO_MATCHED" != "...

tasks.title: [nitpick] The GitHub repository name is hardcoded in the class constructor. This should be configurable through environment variables or constructor parameters to improve reusability across different projects.
tasks.description:
[nitpick] The GitHub repository name is hardcoded in the class constructor. This should be configurable through environment variables or constructor parameters to improve reusability across different projects.

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pull/39#discussion_r2317819703_

tasks.title: [nitpick] The deadline of December 20, 2025 appears very close to the holiday period, which may impact review processes and availability of collaborators. Consider moving the deadline to mid-December or early January to avoid potential delays.
tasks.description:
[nitpick] The deadline of December 20, 2025 appears very close to the holiday period, which may impact review processes and availability of collaborators. Consider moving the deadline to mid-December or early January to avoid potential delays.
```suggestion
January 10, 2026
```

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pull/45#discussion_r2317891947_

tasks.title: Multiple duplicate GitHub issues are being displayed with the same titles and descriptions (e.g., #47, #59, #71 all for "Create Backup Developer Documentation"). This indicates a synchronization issue where the same tasks are being created multiple times instead of being properly deduplicated.
tasks.description:
Multiple duplicate GitHub issues are being displayed with the same titles and descriptions (e.g., #47, #59, #71 all for "Create Backup Developer Documentation"). This indicates a synchronization issue where the same tasks are being created multiple times instead of being properly deduplicated.

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pull/83#discussion_r2317984304_

tasks.title: The task status is inconsistent between different entries. The same task "Create Backup Developer Documentation" appears with status "todo" in some entries and "completed" in others, indicating a synchronization conflict or improper status tracking.
tasks.description:
The task status is inconsistent between different entries. The same task "Create Backup Developer Documentation" appears with status "todo" in some entries and "completed" in others, indicating a synchronization conflict or improper status tracking.

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pull/83#discussion_r2317984323_

tasks.title: The significant increase in GitHub issues (from 35 to 76) and total tasks (from 47 to 88) suggests the synchronization process is creating duplicates rather than properly managing existing tasks. This will lead to confusion and make the task tracking system unreliable.
tasks.description:
The significant increase in GitHub issues (from 35 to 76) and total tasks (from 47 to 88) suggests the synchronization process is creating duplicates rather than properly managing existing tasks. This will lead to confusion and make the task tracking system unreliable.

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pull/83#discussion_r2317984332_

tasks.title: [nitpick] The deadline change reference to "issue #46" is unclear without context. Consider adding a brief explanation of why the deadline was moved or link to the specific issue for transparency.
tasks.description:
[nitpick] The deadline change reference to "issue #46" is unclear without context. Consider adding a brief explanation of why the deadline was moved or link to the specific issue for transparency.
```suggestion
- Paper 2 deadline: 2026-01-10 (holiday buffer - moved to accommodate team availability and holiday schedules; see [issue #46](https://github.com/YuiQuery/whitepapers/issues/46) for details)
```

_Originally posted by @Copilot in https://github.com/stharrold/yuimedi-paper-20250901/pu...
